concept.title: Changing the logging levels of NCC functions

section.title: Overview
section.p:
This procedure is for changing the logging levels for the Java application and is not applicable to the database, CDR, or any /var/log/. Perform this procedure to modify the logging level of one or more NCC functions for troubleshooting purposes. See “Changing NCC logging levels”for information about the logging levels.
Lowering a logging level creates additional log entries and requires more system resources, which can affect system performance. Ensure that you lower the logging level for only the required functions and for only the time required to collect the troubleshooting information.
For day-to-day operations, be sure to review the aggregated logs in the AdminCLI /var/log/ directory rather than the logs on each node in the /opt/tpa/log/ directory.
Modifications to the /opt/tpa/logs/log4j.xml file are not automatically carried over during an upgrade. If you modify the log4j.xml file, after an upgrade you must manually merge your changes from the previous /opt//logs/log4j.xml file to the new /opt/ /logs/log4j.xml file.
Application logs INFO level and lower are sent to the OAM from the application nodes.

ol.li: Open a console window and log in as tpaadmin to the specific node where you want to modify the log level.
Open the log4j.xml file in /opt/tpa/logs/ directory using a text editor.

Perform any of the following:
To change the logging level for general NCC functions, replace logging_level in the following with the logging level that you need, for example, DEBUG.<logger name="com.nokia.tpapps."> <level value="logging_level"/> </logger>
To change the logging level for the Diameter protocol, replace logging_level in the following with the logging level that you need, for example, DEBUG.<logger name="com.nokia.tpapps.diameter"> <level value="logging_level"/> </logger>
Restart the application server after modifying log4j.xml.
Save and close the log4j.xml file.
